content:
• Friday, March 1, 2013
  • OUTD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OUTD +13%. AVD +8%. ITMN +7%. JAKK +7%. GTI +6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OUTD +13%. AVD +8%. ITMN +7%. JAKK +7%. GTI +6%.
    After-hours top losers: CRIS -13%. BPZ -10%. AFCE -8%. CRM -7%. MKTG -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 4 Comments

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: VXX +8.32%. GAZ +5.35%. UNG +3.87. WPS +2.85%. EWJ +1.78%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: VXX +8.32%. GAZ +5.35%. UNG +3.87. WPS +2.85%. EWJ +1.78%.
    ETF Losers: TAN -8.17%. EPI -4.36%. URA -4.13%. GDXJ -3.70%. BNO -3.21%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • DVAX

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX): Q4 EPS of -$0.11. Revenue of $1.8M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX): Q4 EPS of -$0.11. Revenue of $1.8M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • VELTF

    A favorable write-up in the New World Investor newsletter may have helped Velti (VELT +8.4%)...

    A favorable write-up in the New World Investor newsletter may have helped Velti (VELT +8.4%) close with a big gain. The mobile ad agency, crushed a month ago after analyst day comments failed to go over well, delivers its Q4 report on March 12. 42.5% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • CERS

    Cerus (CERS +11%) closes out near its higs for the day after beating on its Q4 result late...

    Cerus (CERS +11%) closes out near its higs for the day after beating on its Q4 result late yesterday. Net sales grew by 6% Y/Y, driven by 14% growth in demand for Incercept disposable kits. Gross margins on product sales were 51%, compared to 37% for Q411.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATEC

    Alphatec (ATEC +16%) soars on a solid Q4 earnings beat, transitioning from a loss in the prior...

    Alphatec (ATEC +16%) soars on a solid Q4 earnings beat, transitioning from a loss in the prior year to a profit. For 2013 the company expects revenue to be in a range between $204M and $210M, or approximately 4% to 7% growth over 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • VLO

    Refiners have a big day as oil dropping to its low of the year while gasoline (NYSEARCA:UGA)...

    Refiners have a big day as oil dropping to its low of the year while gasoline (NYSEARCA:UGA) rises has their profit margin widening even further. VLO +2.3%, TSO +3.5%, WNR +5.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • CEO

    Cnooc (CEO -1.5%) has agreed to cede operating control of Nexen's (NXY) U.S. gulf assets....

    Cnooc (CEO -1.5%) has agreed to cede operating control of Nexen's (NXY) U.S. gulf assets. Drilling leases acquired by the Chinese state-owned oil company as part of its $15B buyout are being altered as a condition of U.S. approval, with the control structure being changed - although CEO still could retain ownership of the economic value of the contracts. U.S. officials had scrutinized the deal because NXY owned more than 200 drilling leases in the Gulf of Mexico, which is a primary source of U.S. oil.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • AABA

    The release of Yahoo's (YHOO +2.8%) 2012 10-K seems to be giving shares a lift. In the filing,...

    The release of Yahoo's (YHOO +2.8%) 2012 10-K seems to be giving shares a lift. In the filing, Yahoo assigned a valuation of $822M to its Alibaba preferred shares (just a small part of its 23% stake in the company) as of year's end. That's up from the $800M valuation assigned in Yahoo's Q3 10-Q.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL -6.4%) slides after SA contributor Xuhua Zhou issues another bearish column....

    UniPixel (UNXL -6.4%) slides after SA contributor Xuhua Zhou issues another bearish column. Going over a 109-page lawsuit filing from private CIT (the suit was originally disclosed in December), Zhou makes note of segments accusing UniPixel of breaching an NDA and appropriating metal CIT's printing technology. Shares took off earlier this week thanks to the outlook provided with UniPixel's Q4 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • Z

    Trulia (TRLA +13.5%) and (to a lesser extent) Zillow (Z +3%) are rallying to close out the week....

    Trulia (TRLA +13.5%) and (to a lesser extent) Zillow (Z +3%) are rallying to close out the week. Short interests for both companies remain pretty high (I, II), in spite of the covering that took place following their Q4 reports. Positive housing data has been providing encouragement to bulls.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • MTP

    DARA Biosciences (DARA -1.1%) says it's appointed Haywood D. Cochrane Jr. as chairman of the...

    DARA Biosciences (DARA -1.1%) says it's appointed Haywood D. Cochrane Jr. as chairman of the board of directors and Paul Richardson as a new board member. Mr. Cochrane has served as a member of DARA's board since February 2008 and has over 30 years of healthcare experience. Mr. Richardson had previously served on the board of a public company specializing in oncology supportive care.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • MSTR

    Business intelligence software firms Microstrategy (MSTR +1%), Qlik (QLIK +2.8%), and Actuate...

    Business intelligence software firms Microstrategy (MSTR +1%), Qlik (QLIK +2.8%), and Actuate (BIRT +5.3%) move higher in the wake of machine data analytics leader Splunk's (SPLK +6.2%) FQ4 beat and strong Q1 guidance. Splunk, now close to its post-IPO highs, boasted on its earnings call of adding 400+ customers in FQ4, up from 350+ in FQ3. $100K+ orders totaled 171, up from 125 in FQ3, and included a $20M deal. Management talked up the potential of the security compliance market (25%-30% of bookings), and said it now has 160 customers on its Storm cloud platform.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • MDVN

    Medivation (MDVN -7%) slides today, despite posting a better than expected Q4 result yesterday....

    Medivation (MDVN -7%) slides today, despite posting a better than expected Q4 result yesterday. Collaboration revenue was $37.2M, more than the $34.4M in Q4 revenue analysts had expected. For FY13 the company expects operating expenses net of cost-sharing payments from Astellas, to be between $285M and $300M, approximately $29M of which consists of non-cash stock-based compensation expense. The company continues to expect approximately $7M in capital expenditures in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • WMGI

    Wright Medical Group (WMGI +1.2%) says it's completed its acquisition of BioMimetic Therapeutics...

    Wright Medical Group (WMGI +1.2%) says it's completed its acquisition of BioMimetic Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BMTI). WMGI acquired BioMimetic for an upfront purchase price of approximately $190M in cash and stock plus additional milestone payments of up to approximately $190M in cash, which are payable upon receipt of FDA approval of its Augment Bone Graft and upon achieving certain revenue milestones.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • WEN

    Wendy's (WEN -3.2%) falls lower after Morgan Stanley lowers its rating to Underweight from...

    Wendy's (WEN -3.2%) falls lower after Morgan Stanley lowers its rating to Underweight from Equal-Weight. The firm thinks macro factors and increased competition makes the short-term tough for the restaurant operator.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • GMXRQ

    Midday top 10 gainers: GMXR +56%. RVLT +37%. MTG +24%. ANAC +15%. DECK +14%. NSPH +13%. KERX...

    Midday top 10 gainers: GMXR +56%. RVLT +37%. MTG +24%. ANAC +15%. DECK +14%. NSPH +13%. KERX +13%. ATEC +13%. CRIS +12%. CIDM +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: SCMR -73%. AT -29%. RNIN -23%. LTBR -23%. FWLT -17%. MDR -14%. SUP -13%. SHIP -13%. MNOV -12%. CBMX -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • CRM

    Surging deferred revenue and healthy free cash flow (over 2x earnings) help Salesforce (CRM...

    Surging deferred revenue and healthy free cash flow (over 2x earnings) help Salesforce (CRM +7.8%) make new highs following its FQ4 report. Needham, lifting its PT to $200, is pleased 7 and 8-figure deals rose 50% Y/Y, albeit while admitting bookings growth (28%) benefited from forex and deal timing. On the earnings call, Marc Benioff promised more M&A - "We're going to buy small and big. We're going to be aggressive." - and boasted 3M+ apps have been developed on Heroku and Force.com.Â WDAY +2.2%. N +2%. MKTG +2.6%. ET-OLD +1.8%. ULTI +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • CLMS

    More signals from Calamos Asset Management (CLMS +2%) where Chairman and CEO John Calamos bumped...

    More signals from Calamos Asset Management (CLMS +2%) where Chairman and CEO John Calamos bumped his stake another 14%, adding about 134K shares to his holdings this week. Last week, he purchased 176K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • TWI

    Titan International (TWI +1.2%) bounces back from early losses after announcing a private...

    Titan International (TWI +1.2%) bounces back from early losses after announcing a private placement for $275M in aggregate principal of its 7.875% Senior Secured Notes due 2017. The company will use the lions share of the net proceeds to repay a portion of the existing debt under the European credit facilities assumed as part of its acquisition of Titan Europe Plc in Q412.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • MTG

    MGIC Investment (MTG +21.5%) continues to fly following yesterday's earnings call in which...

    MGIC Investment (MTG +21.5%) continues to fly following yesterday's earnings call in which management assured capital was there if the company needs to raise it. On this, it was assisted by one of the callers - Craig Perry of Panning Capital - who said (transcript), "Please keep us in mind ... when you think about external capital." The stock is now up 50% from its post-earnings release low.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACER

    Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA +12%) moves up today after disclosing that Nasdaq regulators earlier...

    Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA +12%) moves up today after disclosing that Nasdaq regulators earlier this week agreed to postpone a possible delisting until May 15 after it files its quarterly report for the three months ending March 31. According to its regulatory filing, OPXA was given 45 days to present a plan to regain compliance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • JOE

    The St. Joe (JOE -3.8%) continues to struggle after a nice run over the last year. Last night's...

    The St. Joe (JOE -3.8%) continues to struggle after a nice run over the last year. Last night's earnings showed increasing unit sales and higher prices leading to an 81% Y/Y gain in residential real estate sales in Q4. Total revenue gained 14% Y/Y, but on the conference call, (transcript) management notes adjustments for one-off items in both 2012 and 2011 makes the Y/Y revenue gain a more exciting 33%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • TMO

    Life Technologies (LIFE +1.2%) says it's teamed up with the Instituto de Medicina Genomica to...

    Life Technologies (LIFE +1.2%) says it's teamed up with the Instituto de Medicina Genomica to develop the RapidFinder Equine ID Kit, a testing device that detects the presence of equine DNA extracted from meat samples. The device is available immediately in Europe, Middle East, Africa, and, considering the current horse meat scandal embroiling Europe at present, couldn't be better timed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • NOV

    National-Oilwell Varco (NOV -2.2%) heads south following a downgrade to Sell from Ameriprise...

    National-Oilwell Varco (NOV -2.2%) heads south following a downgrade to Sell from Ameriprise Financial. Shares of the drilling equipment maker have had a rough few months, and currently trade at 11x 2013E EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 8 Comments
  • WNR

    Western Refining (WNR +2.6%) is near its 52-week high after Barclays starts coverage with an...

    Western Refining (WNR +2.6%) is near its 52-week high after Barclays starts coverage with an Overweight and $47 PT. Shares ticked higher yesterday following mixed Q4 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • GRPN

    From Q2 '12 to Q1 '13, fired Groupon (GRPN +7.8%) CEO Andrew Mason's Glassdoor rating fell from...

    From Q2 '12 to Q1 '13, fired Groupon (GRPN +7.8%) CEO Andrew Mason's Glassdoor rating fell from 71% to a mere 39%, a drop indicating many employees also felt it was time for new leadership. Benchmark's Daniel Kurnos, encouraged by Groupon's e-commerce sales (featuring minimal gross profit thus far), is among those who think a turnaround can happen. "There was always a sense that Groupon had a lot of good ideas but no real focus." Among Eric Jackson's suggestions: improve personalization, cut headcount, and emphasize Groupon Now's instant deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • PTN

    Palatin Technologies (PTN +2%) trades up after it says its bremelanotide 1.25 mg and 1.75 mg...

    Palatin Technologies (PTN +2%) trades up after it says its bremelanotide 1.25 mg and 1.75 mg doses significantly increased sexual arousal, sexual desire and the number of sexually satisfying events, and decreased associated distress in premenopausal women with female sexual dysfunction.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 4 Comments
  • IEP

    Icahn Enterprises (IEP -12.5%) prices its secondary at $63/unit, giving Icahn another $200M with...

    Icahn Enterprises (IEP -12.5%) prices its secondary at $63/unit, giving Icahn another $200M with which to battle Bill Ackman on Herbalife (HLF +3%). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 10 Comments
  • YOKU

    Initially crushed due to the light guidance provided with its solid Q4 results, Youku (YOKU...

    Initially crushed due to the light guidance provided with its solid Q4 results, Youku (YOKU -4.5%) is now off more modestly. On the earnings call, management stated ad spending growth from international consumer goods clients could weaken due to macro issues. Youku hopes 2013 growth will be stoked by the full integration of Tudou's ad ops; new ad formats such as product placements and sponsorships; and the arrival of mobile ads. Youku's mobile traffic rose 800% in 2012, with daily video views topping 100M by year's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • SHS

    Sauer-Danfoss (SHS +8.5%) agrees to sell the rest of itself to Danfoss after Danfoss raised its...

    Sauer-Danfoss (SHS +8.5%) agrees to sell the rest of itself to Danfoss after Danfoss raised its offer to $58.50/share in cash from $49 made in late November. Kudos go to SA Pro author Stephen Simpson who said last week SHS had fair value of $62 and management should be ready to walk away if Danfoss didn't better its $49 bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NSPH +9.7%) gets a boost from an initiation at Canaccord with a Buy rating and a $5...

    Nanosphere (NSPH +9.7%) gets a boost from an initiation at Canaccord with a Buy rating and a $5 price target. Canaccord says NSPH is poised to capture a big chunk of the molecular diagnostics business after revamping its strategic approach last year ago to focus on blood stream infections. The company garnered FDA approval of its Gram-Positive Blood Culture Nucleic Acid Test in June 2012, and has become an early leader in the rapid detection of sepsis, which kills around 200K Americans annually and infects over 750K.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • EGHT

    An upgrade to Outperform from Northland leads 8x8 (EGHT +9.4%) to shoot higher; the firm now has...

    An upgrade to Outperform from Northland leads 8x8 (EGHT +9.4%) to shoot higher; the firm now has a PT of $8. Shares fell last month following an FQ3 report that featured an uptick in churn.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -1.8%) and its suppliers slump after iPhone/iPad image sensor provider OmniVision...

    Apple (AAPL -1.8%) and its suppliers slump after iPhone/iPad image sensor provider OmniVision (OVTI -10.9%) issues light guidance to go with its FQ3 beat. CRUS -4.2%. SWKS -1.9%. TQNT -1.7%. AVGO -2%. RFMD -3.2%. BRCM -1.6%. On its FQ3 call, OmniVision would only attribute the guidance to "a seasonal trend of business," while adding smartphone market share trends are "highly, highly volatile right now." Like virtually all other Apple suppliers, OmniVision never mentions Apple by name.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 21 Comments
  • ENMD

    Shares of EntreMed (ENMD -15.2%) gets smacked today after agreeing to sell around 5M shares of...

    Shares of EntreMed (ENMD -15.2%) gets smacked today after agreeing to sell around 5M shares of stock and 2.5M warrants in a registered direct offering. Each unit will be sold for $2.40, and the company says it's already received commitments from institutional investors, including Kleiner Perkins China Fund II and IDG-Accel China Growth Fund III to purchase approximately $10.7M. ENMD expects to net out around $10.3M proceeds once the deal is closed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 2 Comments
  • DAL

    Airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA) move higher after oil prices push even lower. The timing is good...

    Airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA) move higher after oil prices push even lower. The timing is good for the sector with a recent fare hike sticking and demand worries on the backburner at the moment. Advancers: DAL +4.8%, UAL +3.6%, LCC +3.3%, JBLU +2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • SD

    "What is the Street missing," asks an agitated Leon Cooperman (owner of 24M shares) on the...

    "What is the Street missing," asks an agitated Leon Cooperman (owner of 24M shares) on the SandRidge (SD -3.7%) earnings call. Noting TPG's estimate of the company's value is double the current price, Cooperman wants to know why the stock is languishing and how management plans to turn it around. In response, CEO Ward says the company continues to suffer from the "unorthodox" moves taken to stay afloat in 2009. He notes a string of earnings beats and the "extraordinary value" of the Mississippi play.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 19 Comments
  • CHK

    In what should not be a shock, Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3%) discloses the SEC is continuing its...

    In what should not be a shock, Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3%) discloses the SEC is continuing its informal investigation of the company and has issued subpoenas for documents and testimony. The probe regards the practice of giving the CEO (departing next month) stakes in every well the company drills.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 4 Comments
  • SD

    Falling in concert with SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD) are the company's trusts. SDT -4%, PER -2.6%,...

    Falling in concert with SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD) are the company's trusts. SDT -4%, PER -2.6%, SDR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 7 Comments
  • AMFW

    A big Q4 miss and light guidance lead Foster Wheeler (FWLT -17%) to crumble. 2013 EPS is...

    A big Q4 miss and light guidance lead Foster Wheeler (FWLT -17%) to crumble. 2013 EPS is expected to be "flat to moderately down" from a 2012 level of $1.54, as an increase in Global Engineering & Construction EBITDA is offset by a drop in Global Power EBITDA - the Street has been expecting EPS to rise to $2.05. $978M worth of new orders were booked in Q4, down from $1.51B a year ago. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD -5.8%) is off sharply following last night's earnings with investors...

    SandRidge Energy (SD -5.8%) is off sharply following last night's earnings with investors continuing to be frustrated by CEO Tom Ward's leadership. One notes a $365M increase in company debt in Q4, bringing 2012's total to $1.4B. The conference call is underway now. (presentation slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • PGHEF

    Pengrowth Energy (PGH) gains 6.5% after announcing a 55% increase in 2012 year-end proved plus...

    Pengrowth Energy (PGH) gains 6.5% after announcing a 55% increase in 2012 year-end proved plus probable reserves. SA's Albert Alfonso just Wednesday expressed his frustration with the stock, suggesting the firm needs to consider strategic options if the market doesn't begin to properly price its assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • SQNM

    An upgrade to Overweight by Piper Jaffray has Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) up 7.5% premarket to $4.42,...

    An upgrade to Overweight by Piper Jaffray has Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) up 7.5% premarket to $4.42, vs. Piper's raised price target of $6.50. Of some 10 analysts covering the maker of DNA detection and sequencing equipment, seven are at Buy or Outperform vs. just one rating it at Underperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) -4% in spite of its FQ2 beat. On its earnings call, PANW guided...

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) -4% in spite of its FQ2 beat. On its earnings call, PANW guided for FQ3 revenue of $100M-$104M and EPS of $0.05, in-line with a consensus of $101.9M and $0.05. With shares respectively trading at 9.4x and 142x FY14E sales and EPS, the Street was looking for more. Billings +82% Y/Y to $124.3M (more multi-year subscription/maintenance deals), well above revenue of $96.5M; gross margin -70 bps Y/Y to 72.2% thanks to the launch of the mid-range PA-3000 series.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • ISRG

    Premarket gainers: ISRG +9%. SHS +8%. CERS +8%. DECK +8%. SQNM +7%. BBY +6%. PGH +5%.Losers: AT...

    Premarket gainers: ISRG +9%. SHS +8%. CERS +8%. DECK +8%. SQNM +7%. BBY +6%. PGH +5%.
    Losers: AT -34%. FWLT -17%. OVTI -15%. RNIN -14%. IEP -12%. ENMD -12%. YOKU -11%. SD -8%. LYG -8%. CWH -6%. RBS -6%. DB -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • V

    Argus takes its rating on Visa (NYSE:V) down to Hold on a valuation call. V -0.9% premarket.

    Argus takes its rating on Visa (NYSE:V) down to Hold on a valuation call. V -0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • DB

    Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) dives 6.1% premarket as Goldman cuts it to Sell, thanks to new capital...

    Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) dives 6.1% premarket as Goldman cuts it to Sell, thanks to new capital rules which could force the bank to transfer $13B to its U.S. unit. The move would deplete Deutsche's non-U.S. capital, increasing the need for a capital raise. "The impact on Deutsche Bank's profit could be substantial."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) seems to be treading water (at the very least) with its price-matching...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) seems to be treading water (at the very least) with its price-matching program helping to boost sales without destroying gross margins (22.6% vs. 23.1% LY) to the extent some analysts predicted. The retailer's free cash flow also beat most estimates with accounts payable not getting stretched out to accomplish the trick a la J.C. Penney. BBY +6.5% to $17.46 premarket. (Earnings: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    More on Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) Q4: Comparable-store sales grew 0.9% during the period and online...

    More on Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) Q4: Comparable-store sales grew 0.9% during the period and online sales saw a healthy double-digit kick as the retailer regained some of its footing. Though the results showed improvement, the calendar also worked in the retailer's favor during the quarter with a shift for pre-Super Bowl sales into Q4. Adjusted free cash flow came in at $965M vs. recent guidance of $500M. The company says it won't issue any guidance for FY14, but notes it expects $700M-$800M in capital spending. BBY +5.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) reverses yesterday's post-close plunge, with Cantor Fitzgerald...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) reverses yesterday's post-close plunge, with Cantor Fitzgerald calling the FDA probe reaction way overdone and upping the shares to Buy. Janney has spoken to those in the know who say the FDA investigation is not about safety issues on the da Vinci robots. Bair's Ben Andrews calls the probe routine post-market surveillance and says the stock should be bought aggressively under $550. Shares +7.3% premarket to $547.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    Randgold Resources (NYSE:GOLD) slides 1.8% premarket as BlackRock notifies it has unloaded about...

    Randgold Resources (NYSE:GOLD) slides 1.8% premarket as BlackRock notifies it has unloaded about 700K shares, bringing its stake down to 12.9M shares, or 13.99% of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed but European stocks fall following a drop in Chinese PMI and continued...

    Asian shares are mixed but European stocks fall following a drop in Chinese PMI and continued manufacturing contraction in most of the eurozone, while Italy's post-election instability continues to weigh. However, investors are apparently "eerily calm" about the $85B in automatic spending cuts that are due to kick in, but maybe they've just been worn down by it. Japan +0.4%, Hong Kong -0.6%, China -0.3%, India +0.3%. EU Stoxx 50 -0.9%, London +0.1%, Paris -0.8%, Frankfurt -0.1%, Italy -1.4%, Spain -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 AM | 1 Comment
